channel.title: Problem making sample library using the table recorder
channel.description: I'm trying to record audio samples to the SCcard using the audio table recorder to make a sample-library from my modular drums, but somehow it just refuses to write to the sdcard. Although the recorder records to the T1 table, I can't get it to write the table to the sdram.. Am I doing something wrong, or might it be that it ain't yet possible to save these? I'm not trying to record long samples, just small ones (I have tried all different sizes for the table allocate) It's also not that I'm recording lots of things fast after each other.. just one record one sample, then press save.. it may take all the time it needs.. Or is the type of table the wave/play object is using different from the tables the table/record object is making?

item.title: Problem making sample library using the table recorder
item.dc:creator: @johannes johannes
item.description:
@johannes wrote:

Next release will show you a more obvious error hinting at what is wrong...

Read full topic
item.source: Problem making sample library using the table recorder

item.title: Problem making sample library using the table recorder
item.dc:creator: @SirSickSik Remco
item.description:
@SirSickSik wrote:

WHY is it always one of the obvious...?
it seems that last time I re-inserted the usb cable, I accidentally pressed the SDcard.. so it came out.....sigh shame

Read full topic
item.source: Problem making sample library using the table recorder

item.title: Problem making sample library using the table recorder
item.dc:creator: @johannes johannes
item.description:
@johannes wrote:

wave/play assumes 16 bit per sample, your table is set to 32bit per sample. But that would just sound like some sort of distortion. Do you have other evidence that the card is correctly recognized by Axoloti?

Read full topic
item.source: Problem making sample library using the table recorder

item.title: Problem making sample library using the table recorder
item.dc:creator: @SirSickSik Remco
item.description:
@SirSickSik wrote:

I'm trying to record audio samples to the SCcard using the audio table recorder to make a sample-library from my modular drums, but somehow it just refuses to write to the sdcard.
Although the recorder records to the T1 table, I can't get it to write the table to the sdram..

recording sample.jpg968x403 86.3 KB

Am I doing something wrong, or might it be that it ain't yet possible to save these?
I'm not trying to record long samples, just small ones (I have tried all different sizes for the table allocate)
It's also not that I'm recording lots of things fast after each other.. just one record one sample, then press save.. it may take all the time it needs..
Or is the type of table the wave/play object is using different from the tables the table/record object is making?

Read full topic
